comments.body: Well, this code still makes my brain hurt, but the patch looks fine to me :-)
f2py does great things, but there is a reason no one else has chosen to work on it ;-)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +431,435 @@        build_dir = os.path.join(tempfile.mktemp())

    _reg1 = re.compile(r'[-][-]link[-]')
    sysinfo_flags = [_m for _m in sys.argv[1:] if _reg1.match(_m)]
    sys.argv = [_m for _m in sys.argv if _m not in sysinfo_flags]

comments.body: Seems kinda pointless to show this twice

Agree, but it might break something downstream if removed. My intent was to keep the changes isolated in the `__version__.py` file in case we later want to make other changes in reporting the version.

~Hmm, the broken test is interesting and I'm not sure how to fix it so that is also runs with `runtests.py`, which seems to use the system installed `f2py` rather than the new build. Looks like the test has always been broken anyway as previously the f2py version never changed.~
